_metadata.notes: Comprehensive extraction of Veeva MDL component types including Quality-specific (Quality*, Qms*), RIM-specific (Rim*), Clinical-specific (Clinical*, Disclosure*), Document-specific (Doc*), Mobile, and core platform components

Accountmessage.description: View and edit messages that Vault sends to users as both emails and in-application notifications.

Actiontrigger.description: An Action Trigger allows you to create and execute custom business logic when a create, update, or delete record operation occurs on an object record.

Appsecurityrule.description: Internal Vault developers use Application Security Rules to control access to records.

Atomicsecurity.description: Atomic security provides an additional layer of control by allowing you to configure security at the lifecycle state and/or assigned role level.

Casechildconfig.description: Configuration details of a Case Child section in the Medical Inquiry user interface, available only in MedInquiry Vaults.

Checklisttype.description: Checklists are a data entry method that allows a user to enter data in question and answer format.

Clientdistribution.description: Represents a Client Code Distribution containing Custom Pages code uploaded via Vault API. This component type is read-only.

Clinicalstandardmapping.description: Specific to Clinical Operations Vaults, supports CTMS Transfer feature. Maps custom fields and values to standard fields for Study data transfer between CRO and Sponsor Vaults.

Customwebapi.description: Developers can create custom web APIs using the Vault Java SDK.

Dashboard.description: Dashboards provide an at-a-glance understanding of key metrics.

Disclosurerule.description: Specific to Clinical Operations Vaults, supports Veeva Disclosures feature. Controls user actions that trigger Vault to create Disclosure records for supported registries.

Disclosurexmldoctypemapping.description: Specific to Clinical Operations Vaults, supports Veeva Disclosures feature. Maps document types for inclusion when posting Related Documents to ClinicalTrials.gov or Custom XML.

Disclosurexmlfieldmapping.description: Specific to Clinical Operations Vaults, supports Veeva Disclosures feature. Maps custom Disclosure object fields for inclusion in Disclosure XML files.

Docatomicsecurity.description: Atomic security for documents provides granular control over who can perform specific lifecycle user actions based on lifecycle state and role.

Docfield.description: Attribute of a document associated to one or more document types.

Docfielddependency.description: Dependent fields configuration that defines relationships between a controlling field and one or more dependent fields.

Docfieldlayout.description: Defines how a field layout section appears on the Doc Info page in the Vault UI.

Doclifecycle.description: Document lifecycles are the sequences of states a document goes through during its life.

Docmatchingrule.description: Dynamic Access Control (DAC) is an access control model for documents, which automates the assignment of users to document roles.

Docparticipantrule.description: Workflow participant rules control which document fields force the selected role to be required or hidden in the workflow start dialog.

Docrelationshiptype.description: Document relationship types define the type of relationship between two documents.

Doctype.description: Document types refer to a hierarchical taxonomy to differentiate the various types of documents stored in Vault.

Documentaction.description: Documents can have custom actions that perform specific instructions.

Documentcheck.description: Document checks are document type-specific checklist items displayed in the Document Readiness panel to help guide users in documentation reviews.

Documentchecksection.description: Document check sections contain document checks within the Document Readiness panel in the Vault UI.

Documentstagegroup.description: Lifecycle Stages allow organizations to group document lifecycle states into ordered collections of stages.

Emailprocessor.description: When creating Inbound Email Addresses in the Vault Admin UI, Admins select an Email Processor.

Formattedoutput.description: Formatted output templates allow quick transfer of complete object record data into a customized template file.

Inboundemailaddress.description: When configuring Email to Vault, Admins use Inbound Email Addresses to create and manage Vault-owned email addresses.

Integrationrule.description: Integration Rules provide platform configuration and SDK services for developers building Vault to Vault integration features.

Job.description: Vault's job scheduler provides a simpler, streamlined way for Admins to create a batch operation and schedule it to repeatedly execute.

Jobmetadata.description: The Jobmetadata component is used to define the metadata of an SDK Job.

Labelset.description: Label Sets allow Vault Admins to specify alternative Vault UI labels within a single language.

Layoutprofile.description: Layout profiles are collections of layouts for various objects.

Layoutrule.description: Layout rules streamline the data entry process by dynamically hiding irrelevant fields and sections on an object record detail page.

Lifecyclestatetype.description: Lifecycle state types are groups of lifecycle states across lifecycles that share common behaviors.

Lifecyclestatetypeassociation.description: Lifecycle state type associations join a state and a lifecycle state type record.

Link.description: Defines a Web Action that allows users to execute links to external URLs.

Matchingrule.description: Matching Sharing Rules are part of Dynamic Access Control for objects.

Messagedeliveryeventhandler.description: Spark message delivery event handlers contain custom logic that executes when a Spark message is delivered to a remote queue.

Messagegroup.description: To provide a localized experience, Vault Java SDK developers can create translations for messages displayed to the end user in Vault.

Messageprocessor.description: Spark message processors provide logic to handle Spark messages.

Mobileshareactionconfig.description: Configuration for Vault Mobile sharing actions that define how files can be shared to Vault from smartphones.

Mobiletab.description: A tab within the UI of Vault Mobile. Admins can configure mobile tabs from Mobile Setup in the Vault UI.

Notificationtemplate.description: Defines a template for email and notification messages sent by Vault.

Object.description: Objects define the data model for the Vault.

Objectaction.description: Object user actions are configurable instances of a Vault Action that you can define for an object and object types.

Objectlifecycle.description: Definition of the lifecycle of an Object.

Objectlifecyclestagegroup.description: Lifecycle Stages allow organizations to group object lifecycle states into ordered collections of stages.

Objecttype.description: An object type is a collection of fields that are grouped to capture similar but not identical data within a single object.

Objectvalidation.description: Validation rules enhance data quality by comparing user-entered data with Admin-defined rules for an object record.

Objectworkflow.description: Object workflows apply to a single object lifecycle and a single object.

Outboundemaildomain.description: Defines the configuration of an Outbound Email Domain. Specific to MedInquiry, Clinical, and QMS Vaults with Outbound Email Domains enabled.

Overlaytemplate.description: Overlays allow you to apply information to a viewable rendition when users download it from Vault.

Page.description: This component defines a custom page in Vault.

Pagelayout.description: The layout of an object detail page.

Pagelink.description: Represents a page link that navigates users to custom URL or Custom Page destinations.

Permissionset.description: Permission sets are a way to group permissions together.

Picklist.description: Picklists allow users to select a value for a field from a range of predefined options.

Printableviewtestscript.description: Defines the configuration of a Printable View for Test Scripts, specific to Quality Vaults with Veeva Validation Management enabled.

Qmsactionpathconfiguration.description: Specific to Quality family Vaults, supports the Change Control features. Action Paths allow administrators to define Action Paths and Steps for the Change Control Process.

Qmsautomationusertemplate.description: Specific to Quality family Vaults, supports External Audit Collaboration features. Used to automatically create External User accounts for existing Person records.

Qualitybatchroleassignment.description: Specific to Quality family Vaults, supports the Batch Release Role Assignment feature. Defines a Batch Disposition Role Assignment.

Qualitycurriculumsmartmatchrule.description: Specific to Quality family Vaults, supports Curriculum Matching feature. Defines a Curriculum Matching Rule to automatically assign Curricula to Learners.

Qualitydistributiongroupfilterset.description: Specific to Quality family Vaults, supports External Notifications feature. Defines filters to limit Persons available for inclusion in a Distribution Group.

Qualitydynamicenrollmentrule.description: Specific to Quality family Vaults, supports Dynamic Enrollment feature. Defines a Dynamic Enrollment Rule to automatically assign Learner roles to a Person.

Qualityexternalnotification.description: Available only in Quality Vaults with QMS enabled. Defines a Quality External Notification for distribution groups, notification templates, emails, and document sharing.

Qualityexternalnotificationtemplate.description: Available only in Quality Vaults with QMS enabled. Defines a Notification Template for Quality External Notifications.

Qualityextractentityconfig.description: Specific to Quality family Vaults, supports Supplier Change Notification feature. Defines an Extract Entity Configuration.

Qualityinboundemailaddressconfiguration.description: Specific to Quality family Vaults, supports Complaint Email Ingestion and Supplier Change Notice Email Ingestion features.

Qualityincidentintakelayout.description: Available only in Quality Vaults with QMS enabled. Defines a Quality Incident Layout Configuration for intake forms.

Qualityobjectrelationshipconfig.description: Defines how records of a configured object type will be duplicated and inverted to support bidirectional relationships.

Qualityreasonforchange.description: Available only in Quality Vaults with QMS enabled. Defines a Reason for Change configuration to prompt users for a reason upon editing specific fields.

Qualityrecordcheck.description: Defines the configuration for a Quality Record Check for checking recurrences and duplicates.

Qualityrecordcheckinsight.description: Available only in Quality Vaults with QMS enabled. Defines the configuration for a Quality Record Check Insight.

Qualityrecordchecklifecycleassociation.description: Available only in Quality Vaults with QMS enabled. Defines the lifecycle state associations for a Quality Record Check.

Qualityreportabilitydecisiontreeconfig.description: Available only in Quality Vaults with QMS or VPS enabled. Defines the configuration for a Reportability Decision Tree.

Qualityteam.description: Specific to Quality family Vaults, supports Quality Teams feature. Allows users to make individual work assignments to Change Controls, Audits, CAPAs, or other processes.

Qualityteamlifecycleassociation.description: Available only in Quality Vaults with QMS enabled. Defines the lifecycle associations for a Quality Team.

Queue.description: Spark messaging is a message notification system that allows for loosely coupled, asynchronous, near real-time integration between Vaults or external applications.

Recordaction.description: Custom actions for records, called record actions, are invoked by a user on a specific record from the UI or API.

Recordmergeeventhandler.description: Record merge event handlers contain custom logic to execute as a merge starts or after the merge finishes.

Recordroletrigger.description: Record role triggers execute custom code whenever roles are directly (manually) added or removed from an object record.

Recordtrigger.description: Record triggers execute custom code when a record Event occurs.

Recordworkflowaction.description: Record workflow actions execute custom code during object workflow events.

Relatedrecordsetup.description: Defines a Related Record Configuration for automatically creating related object records when source records enter specific lifecycle states.

Renditionprofile.description: Rendition profiles allow you to choose rendition settings that differ from the Vault-wide rendition settings.

Renditiontype.description: Renditions are files that users can add to documents. Rendition types describe the kind or purpose of the rendition.

Reportexceltemplate.description: Excel Report Templates allow users to create report templates in Microsoft Excel, upload them to Vault, and export report data into those templates.

Reporttype.description: Report Type determines the reporting objects for Vault reports.

Rimdoctypeconfig.description: RIM Document Type Configurations define the document types, subtypes, and classifications available for extracting Health Authority Questions and Commitments.

Rimeventchangedetail.description: Event Change Details are the building blocks of Event Change Types in RIM Vaults.

Rimeventchangetype.description: Event Change Types define the required and optional details for a specific kind of change in the Create Event Details wizard.

Rimobjectconfiguration.description: Rimobjectconfigurations define properties for RIM objects used across Veeva Submissions and Veeva Registrations features.

Rimobjectmapping.description: RIM Object Mappings define which RIM objects and fields are mapped when data is moved between objects from various RIM processes and wizards.

Rolepermissionset.description: Role permissions enable Admins to assign permissions to a specific user without affecting security profiles.

Savedview.description: Saved or custom views allow users to save or bookmark current searches, filters, and other view settings.

Sdkjob.description: Job processors provide logic to process jobs in bulk.

Searchablefield.description: Definition of a searchable object Field.

Searchcollection.description: Search collections allow you to create and edit groups of documents and objects that users can search at the same time as expanded searches.

Securityprofile.description: Security profiles are how Vault applies permissions sets to individual users.

Selfevidentcorrection.description: Specific to Clinical Operations Vaults, supports Quality Issues feature. Allows QC Specialists to correct specific errors while tracking Quality Issues.

Sharingrule.description: Vault uses Sharing Rules to manage users' roles on specific object records by matching rule criteria to specific user assignments.

Signaturepage.description: Signature pages display the manifested signatures for a Vault document.

Stationconfiguration.description: Specific to Quality family Vaults, supports Configurable Document Metadata feature of Station Manager application.

Tab.description: A Tab within the UI of Vault.

Tabcollection.description: Tab collections are groups of related tabs relevant to particular roles or tasks.

Tag.description: Admins can create tags to label any document with a topic, category, or any other type of identification.

Tagsecurityrule.description: Internal Vault developers use Tag Security Rules to control access to records.

Userdefinedclass.description: Allow users to apply custom business logic on objects when a record is created, updated, or deleted.

Userdefinedmodel.description: Allows users to create reusable data access objects, or models, and annotate their getters and setters as user-defined properties.

Userdefinedservice.description: Allow users to wrap reusable logic into a service that can be used by other Vault Java SDK code.

Vaulttoken.description: This component type stores tokens which can be resolved Vault-wide.

Visualhierarchyconfiguration.description: Visual Hierarchies form the backbone of the Process Navigator page in Veeva QualityDocs. Configurations determine which fields are available on Visual Hierarchy detail pages.

Webapigroup.description: Each Customwebapi must be assigned to a Webapigroup.

Workflow.description: A workflow is a series of steps configured in Vault to align with a specific business purpose.
